BufferedOutputStream(java.io.OutputStrea.Description: Creates a new buffered output stream to write data to the specified underlying output stream with the specified buffer size.
Creates a new buffered output stream to write data to the specified underlying output stream with the specified buffer size.
Creates a new buffered output stream to write data to the specified underlying output stream.

flush().Description: Flushes this buffered output stream. This forces any buffered output bytes to be written out to the underlying output stream.

close().Description: Closes this stream. This implementation closes the target stream.

Parameters: int: the start offset in the data.
int: the number of bytes to write.
write(byte[],int,int).Description: Writes len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset off to this buffered output stream. Ordinarily this method stores bytes from the given array into this stream's buffer, flushing the buffer to the underlying output stream as needed. If the requested length is at least as large as this stream's buffer, however, then this method will flush the buffer and write the bytes directly to the underlying output stream. Thus redundant BufferedOutputStreams will not copy data unnecessarily.
write(byte[],int,int).FullName: public void write (byte[] b, int off, int len)

Parameters: int: the start offset in the data.
int: the number of bytes to write.
write(byte[], int, int).Description: Writes len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset off to this buffered output stream. Ordinarily this method stores bytes from the given array into this stream's buffer, flushing the buffer to the underlying output stream as needed. If the requested length is at least as large as this stream's buffer, however, then this method will flush the buffer and write the bytes directly to the underlying output stream. Thus redundant BufferedOutputStreams will not copy data unnecessarily.
write(byte[], int, int).FullName: public void write (byte[] b, int off, int len)

Parameters: int: the byte to be written.
write(int).Description: Writes the specified byte to this buffered output stream.

ClassDesc: The class implements a buffered output stream. By setting up such an output stream, an application can write bytes to the underlying output stream without necessarily causing a call to the underlying system for each byte written.
